rsn: When comparing the two images, we observe that the objects in the target image appear slightly shifted counterclockwise relative to their positions in the source image. This suggests that the camera has rotated clockwise to achieve the perspective seen in the target image. The shift in the position of the shower head and the bottles on the edge of the bathtub supports this observation.
label: clockwise

rsn: To determine the camera movement between the source and target images, I analyzed the orientation of the objects within the room. In the target image, the window frame appears slightly tilted compared to the source image. Specifically, the left edge of the window frame seems to be higher than the right edge when viewed in the target image, indicating a counterclockwise rotation of the camera. This shift suggests that the camera was rotated counterclockwise along its viewing axis to capture the target image.
label: clockwise
